case_vignette: A 75-year-old woman presents with sudden loss of vision. She says that she was reading when suddenly she was not able to see the print on half of the page. Her symptoms started 4 hours ago and are accompanied by a severe posterior headache. Vital signs reveal the following: blood pressure 119/76 mm Hg, pulse 89/min, SpO2 98% on room air. The patient was unable to recognize her niece when she arrived to see her. A noncontrast CT of the head shows no evidence of hemorrhagic stroke.
question: What is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Neurology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I suddenly lost my vision while reading, and now I can't see half of the page, and I also have a severe headache in the back of my head.
Are you currently taking any medications?
The case vignette doesn't mention any medications that I'm taking.
Do you have a history of any medical conditions?
The case vignette doesn't provide any information about my past medical history.
Do you have any family history of neurological conditions, such as migraines or strokes?
The case vignette doesn't provide any information about my family medical history.
I see. How old are you?
I am 75 years old.

Thank you. Based on your symptoms and age, as well as the sudden onset, I would like to consider the possibility of a condition known as posterior cerebral artery infarction. Do you have any other symptoms such as weakness or difficulty speaking?
I was unable to recognize my niece when she came to see me.
**Final Diagnosis:** Posterior cerebral artery infarction
